memberdef.definition: MatrixRow< T, H > mc::Vector< MatrixRow< T, H > , N >::content[N]
memberdef.name: content

briefdescription.para: A class representing a 2-dimensional matrix, and allows for math involving matrices.

detaileddescription.para: A Matrix can be known as a Vector of Vectors.
Matrices can be added, subtracted, and multiplyed by eachother, and by Vectors of equal width.
There are various type aliases in place to prevent using the template parameters. They all use the following syntax: Matrix[size][prefix] or Matrix[width]x[height][prefix]

Prefixes exist for every primitive type and are the first letter of the primitive name. For example, the prefix for a float would be f and the prefix for an int would be i. Primitives with modifiers simply add the letter. The prefixed for an unsigned char would be uc and the prefix for a long long int would be lli
Sizes exist for matrices up to 5x5

For example, to create a Matrix that consists of floats and is 4 by 4 in size, you would use Matrix4f. For a 3 by 2 Matrix of unsigned ints, you would use Matrix3x2ui
Vector
T
What the Matrix should consist of. Can be any type.
W
The width of the Matrix which must be greater than 0
H
The height of the Matrix which must be greater than 0
